title: Research Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Dartmouth
Interview Descriptions: Initial screening zoom call with hiring manager, faculty, and admin a few weeks after submitted application. Mostly questions about my background and experience and we had a great scientific conversation. I learned more about the role and the structure of the department. I then had an on-site interview a week or two later (arriving in the evening, full day interview, send-off the following morning). I had a full day of meetings with a wide variety of prospective colleagues, some 1:1 and some matrix meetings. I have a 45-min presentation on my research, which drove many of my conversations throughout the day. I strongly enjoyed the team, environment and leadership, and I think I would have made great contributions in this role. I ultimately felt that a competing industry offer was a better fit for me.
Interview Questions: What is your research experience?

title: Machine Shop Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Dartmouth (Hanover, NH) in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions: The interview wasn't much of the process. As I have been in and out of the machine shop before and people there know me, plus I am an engineering major, they took me on. If you find you didn't get selected, or if you want to take precautions, you should go chat with the receptionist and the admin manager in the MShop.
Interview Questions: How long are you willing to commit to the MShop consecutively?

title: Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Dartmouth
Interview Descriptions: Wonderful, very lovely people and a beautiful place to work! Interview was a very straightforward and easy process- very easygoing and relaxed conversation with all parties that I interviewed with.
Interview Questions: How would you describe yourself?

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Dartmouth
Interview Descriptions: Relaxed, the interviewer is very welcoming and the entire process last about 30 min with me asking some questions about the role last. Relaxed, the interviewer is very welcoming and the entire process last about 30 min with me asking some questions about the role last
Interview Questions: Tell me a time when yo work with data

title: Talent Acquisition Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Dartmouth (Hanover, NH) in Dec 2022
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with the hiring manager. The job description did not clearly reflect job duties, so a lot of time was needed to clarify the role. The manager was new to the role and said the team was new, too. It seemed like the team needed more time to figure out its place within the institution.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your experience.

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Dartmouth
Interview Descriptions: it wasn't too bad pretty straight forward i enjoyed talking to professors and learning about the different types of masters of engineering programs that they had in particular i am planning on pursuing the electrical engineering master of engineering. wish me luck!
Interview Questions: Why do you want to pursue a Masters degree

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Dartmouth
Interview Descriptions: Disorganized and disrespectful interview process. It seems HR is not coordinated with the professors and they do not treat applicants well. Did not get the sense that the School of A&S is a caring place.
Interview Questions: Experience in raising funding through proposals.

title: Software Tester Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Dartmouth
Interview Descriptions: Suffice it to say it wasn't worth mentioning due to nondisclosure and various noncompliance usage versus non usage as pertains to nondisclosure. Beyond that the particulars were particularly understandable. In closing I would definitely recommend this place was the last time the idea was as it was.
Interview Questions: They asked if I was willing to refrain from recording.

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Dartmouth
Interview Descriptions: Initial screening call with the supervisor that was pretty informal and low threat. After that moved onto to a full interview day with the full team and other stakeholders. There were no written exercises or anything like that. The questions ranged from "getting to know you" sorts of questions to different scenarios one might encounter in the role.
Interview Questions: Describe what kind of team member you are

title: Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Dartmouth
Interview Descriptions: It was a standard zoom interview for about 30 minutes. Was told they would get back in a week or two. Ghosted and saw reject on the website. How hard is it to just send a 1 line email and be courteous.
Interview Questions: Why Dartmouth? Why would you be a good fit for the position? What are your strengths and weaknesses? etc

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Dartmouth
Interview Descriptions:
It was an internal process. I reached out to professor directly and did not submit my resume to HR. He accepted me after reviewing my resume and my background. 
He asked me to visit him in his office and asked me some questions about programming.
Interview Questions: What's your future term plan?

title: PhD Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Dartmouth (New York, NY) in Dec 2021
Interview Descriptions: Great conversation for an hour. We have matched research interest and we also have similar view on Ph.D or Laboratory group. I don't know about the result yet but I think its positive.
Interview Questions: What are some of the research you have been working on?

title: Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Dartmouth
Interview Descriptions: Very enjoyable! Had a few conversations with important figures in the lab who gave me a great idea of what the lab and the area would be like. Very laid back.
Interview Questions: How do you handle failure?

title: Alumni Relations Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Dartmouth (Hanover, NH) in May 2021
Interview Descriptions:
Lengthy, complex interview process took over 3 months and involved web-based interviews, skills assessments and an extremely detailed reference check process.
Reference check process unnecessarily detailed and inappropriate for type of job and had requirements that were not fair to candidate or aligned with industry practice.
Continued references by recruiter to Dartmouth's need to perform "due diligence" gave a poor impression.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Dartmouth
Interview Descriptions: They just asked for my resume and then proceeded to hire me. There was no formal interview process because they needed people. I just spoke to the manager and got the job.
Interview Questions: When can you start working?

title: Associate Director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Dartmouth
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with Human Resources department at Dartmouth for a position in their alumni relations office. The initial process was smooth, but the follow up was less transparent than I think job seekers deserve.
Interview Questions: What about your skillset makes you well situated to this role?

title: Library Desk Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Dartmouth
Interview Descriptions:
Really great, just express interest early before positions fill up
Really great, just express interest early before positions fill up
Really great, just express interest early before positions fill up
Really great, just express interest early before positions fill up
Interview Questions: What is your availability for the job?

title: Learning Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Dartmouth (Hanover, NH) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: It was a virtual interview. I was asked about my previous teaching experience, and my strategies for facilitating learning. I was given several in-class room scenarios and asked how I would navigate them.
Interview Questions: What is one teaching challenge you've overcome in the past?

title: Executive Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Dartmouth
Interview Descriptions: Odd is all I can say, it seemed un-organized and disjointed. It seemed the department didnt want to work with central HR or Talent Acquisition. However once I was connected with Talent Acquisition it was smooth and easy to understand what Dartmouth had to offer. They told me details about relocating and benefits information. The questions they asked were based on the position and about me as a person. What I am passionate about and why I wanted to work at Dartmouth.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Dartmouth?

title: Writer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Dartmouth
Interview Descriptions: I went through a series of very well-organized, friendly, and helpful interviews. The process was non-intimidating; I really felt that the team wanted to know if I'd make a good fit rather than interrogate me. It gave me a very positive impression of working at Dartmouth.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself.

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Dartmouth
Interview Descriptions: It is a skype interview, only one advisor asked some questions about the the previous educational background, current research areas, and future plans. Overall, it is really nice experience. In addition, it should be better prepare some questions related to the advisor's research
Interview Questions: what are your current research interests and future plans

title: Project Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Dartmouth (Hanover, NH) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, was contacted directly by my future boss, hired during the interview, and was contacted by HR a week later. The interview itself was very straightforward. They asked about my personality and experiences, but did not focus on typical interview question. It was very conversational.
Interview Questions: Tell me of a time when you had to deal with a difficult co-worker or customer, how did you handle it?

title: Research Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Dartmouth (Lebanon, NH) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: Several one on one interviews and a group interview.  There was also a take home programming assignment and some straightforward whiteboard questions.  All and all it was a very friendly and reasonable process.
Interview Questions: What type of position are you looking for?

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Dartmouth (Hanover, NH) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: Basic interview with several faculties discussing your information and interests. You just tell them about what you learnt, what you have done for research, and what your passion is
Interview Questions: No specific question asked

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Dartmouth in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: highly variable. Depends on the professor.  My guess is that most profs know who they will accept before the interview.  There's a lot of nepotism that is usually involved as well
Interview Questions: Tell me about your research

title: Student Tour Guide Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Dartmouth (Hanover, NH) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: There was a written application and panel interview. The application was roughly 6 short essay questions about the Dartmouth experience and the interview was a few short questions and a 5 minute presentation on a component of my Dartmouth experience.
Interview Questions: Please discuss the socioeconomic gap at Dartmouth, does it exist? Has it affected your Dartmouth experience?

title: Processing Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Dartmouth (Princeton, MA) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: Interview was set up through phone and email, I had a Skype interview a month after the initial application was submitted. They kept me appraised of the timeline and it was the best processes I have encountered thus far.
Interview Questions: Why did you choose archives rather than pursue archeology?

title: Student Technology Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Dartmouth
Interview Descriptions: I was asked my past work experience and why I was interested in the job. I gave them a resume and they told me they would update me about the status.
Interview Questions: What is your experience working with computers?

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Dartmouth (Hanover, NH) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions:
I have spent the entire day at Dartmouth. However, it was a very pleasant experience.
I have met my future boss and other professors. We did not have a strict schedule, everything was very flexible.
Every single person was so easy going. We talked about science in general, about research in lab, and about transferability of my skills.
Interview Questions: How is it possible to build the bridge between your skill set and our needs?

title: Campus Tour Guide Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Dartmouth (Hanover, NH)
Interview Descriptions: After submitting the original application, candidates were selected to be interviewed by a panel of admissions officers. Most of it was to assess public speaking skills, and how well you can articulate and relay information in a concise and engaging manner.
Interview Questions: A 30 second pitch for an admissions-related topic (e.g., quarter system; study-abroad)

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Dartmouth
Interview Descriptions: The process simply involves either you contacting the prof or the prof contacting you to be a TA for his or her class. If your performance in the class was satisfactory then you get the job. Application to each course happens every term.
Interview Questions: What are your other obligations this term?

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Dartmouth
Interview Descriptions:
On-campus interview. Five interviews in a day, 30 min each.
Graduate students also have a say in this process, need to mingle with them during lunch time and the party, etc.
Interview Questions: Quite casual, talking about research project

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Dartmouth
Interview Descriptions: There was no formal interview process, just the submission of application materials. My impression is that GRE scores and entrance essays seem to carry a lot of weight, so I would spend some time studying for the GRE and also crafting your entrance essays.
Interview Questions: Some professors will directly ask you what you want to study while at Dartmouth. Have something in mind to say.

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Dartmouth (Hanover, NH) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: Stay far, far away.  My experience applying for and interviewing for an executive assistant role has been nothing short of surreal.  The process was grueling - a phone screen, 2 writing assignments, on campus interview, case study, another on campus interview, multiple phone calls.  The require 5 references and a background check, in addition to speaking with your current supervisor.  I refused to let them contact my current boss and they lost it.  Received angry phones, accused me of being disingenuous through the interview process and basically try to bully me into doing what they wanted.   Never, ever have had any experience like this before.
Interview Questions: The wanted to speak with my current employer

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Dartmouth (Hanover, NH) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions:
Dartmouth HR/ER requires that they speak with your boss before they will hire you.  This practice is highly inappropriate and came as a complete surprise.  Obviously, candidates do not want to share their job search with their current or previous manager and they shouldn't have to.  In addition, many employer's don't want their supervisors verifying employment due to liability purposes and ask that any employment and reference verifications go through a third party or a specific process (i.e., as not to be personal in nature), so not offering someone a job on this basis is wholly unfair.   Candidates have no control over this and should not be penalized over this ridiculous made- up- rule.   Last but not least, your release forms are general and do not indicate that hiring is dependent on a favorable reference from current/previous supervisor.  You should be honest about this- because once again you are using this as a basis to make hiring decisions.  (Yes, you did this with me.) 

As I read in other testimonials, it is never disclosed up front, but mentioned after the interview, and mentioned as "oh I forgot to mention...but before we send you this offer,  I just need to speak to your boss.... We won't be able to move forward with the offer without a conversation between myself and your boss. "   Don't put your valuable time and energy into this institution as they will literally throw it away if they don't get to speak to your boss on their terms.   Absolute insanity.   I can't imagine how many wonderful candidates they have lost out on due to horrible bosses that didn't want to let their people go or who had an axe to grind.   It is too late to help myself.  But maybe this will help one person.  Dartmouth- Please stop this practice.
Interview Questions: Situational questions [Interview was challenging, but I feel that it should have been challenging considering what I was applying for.]   It was also a great experience and I feel I was well prepared.   They did a nice job with the interview and schedule.  I was truly excited to be there.

title: Instructional Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Dartmouth (Hanover, NH)
Interview Descriptions: Online Interview through Go To Meeting -Panel of 3 Interviewers -  Open ended questions related to instructional design process (describe your process of planning an instructional lesson/training, how would you determine if students were making progress in self-paced environment?, etc.).  Interview team was professional and friendly.  Interview lasted approximately 45 minutes.  Made timeline clear and followed timeline.  Positive experience.
Interview Questions: Describe process of planning instructional activity.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Dartmouth (Hanover, NH)
Interview Descriptions: It took about 2 weeks before classes started. i had to show i was capable of helping students with the subject area I assisted the professor with. It was more like can I do the job interview and my availability.
Interview Questions: Describe strengths and weaknesses.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Dartmouth (Hanover, NH) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is incredibly informal. The purpose is more to ensure you're familiar with the general workings of the library and research processes and could help someone with very general questions. You're not required to have an in-depth knowledge as those can go to your supervisor, and you're more or less responsible for knowing what direction to point someone in.
Interview Questions: How would you begin to assist someone with a research project?

title: Managerial Position/Research Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Dartmouth in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: First, by email, then by phone. In person interview with the team and hiring manager. Final interview with the Director of the center. Then they talked to my references from past jobs. They then asked to talk to my current employer.
Interview Questions: How do you work in a team?

title: Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Dartmouth (Hanover, NH) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions:
The interview process was fairly intensive. Initially, I submitted a resume and cover letter. I was contacted by admin and shortly had two 30 minute phone interviews with research project managers on staff. The questions were a combination of reviewing my former experiences, a few scenario questions, and asking about why I wanted to be a fellow and how it fit my overall career plans. After this I was flown on site for a day long interview process. This consisted of several one-on-one interviews with other project managers and faculty. Additionally we had a written assignment analyzing data, and a group presentation with other interviewees. The final steps were contacting three references, and a written assessment responding to a policy prompt.
I was offered a job a week after the final assignment.
Interview Questions: How does this job contribute to your overall career goals?

title: Position Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Dartmouth
Interview Descriptions: It was a very lengthy interview process... multiple interviews/chats, a panel phone screen, long visit with a nice tour. Everyone was friendly though! I wouldn't recommend going out of your way unless you LOVE Dartmouth... as these people clearly do, which is a great thing. Location isn't especially great if you are not accustomed to NH life.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Senior Associate Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Dartmouth
Interview Descriptions: One of the most streamlined interview processes I've had.  Worked with one contact in the hiring department.  Had a phone screening for the position with her.  One week later had a phone interview with the hiring manager.  About two weeks after that I was contacted to make arrangements to travel to campus for an on-campus interview.  I appreciated that they gave me two weeks notice to inform my current employer.  They made my travel arrangements and were very helpful.  I had four different sessions and I thought the first three went well, but I could tell the division VP didn't like me in the last session (he was very, very obvious about that).  A week after my return, I received a detailed letter explaining why they hadn't chosen me, which I expected after the last session.  I appreciated the detail in the response, so many people just blow you off when you are not selected.  My reimbursal for travel expenses was also very quick.  Overall, a pretty pleasant interview experience even if the only thing that came out of it was a chance to spend some time in that part of the country - it's so beautiful there.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Dartmouth (Hanover, NH) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: There was no real formal interview process for this. No formal questions although background on classes taken and knowledge of state was required for the overall hiring process through the Economics department.
Interview Questions: There were no questions involved.

title: Undergraduate Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Dartmouth (Hanover, NH) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: Submitted online application and had an interview a week later. Interview was mainly gauging how passionate you were about the job, if you were competent, and if you understand what the job description really meant (beyond the words)
Interview Questions: What would you do if you encountered alcohol in a residence hall?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Dartmouth (Hanover, NH)
Interview Descriptions: Phone screen followed by an afternoon of interviews including 2 group interviews
Interview Questions: What will be your biggest challenge in this role?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Dartmouth (Hanover, NH)
Interview Descriptions: I directly apply it online and mail the application to them. I don't have interview for this school
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Dartmouth (Hanover, NH) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: I was called for a job talk, and had several meetings with lots of faculty.  They were all very supportive in general.  No stress process.  Make sure you make good with the main contact person.  I would encourage people to apply here, at least for a short tenure job.
Interview Questions: What are my teaching goals and philosophies?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Dartmouth (Hanover, NH) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: Applied on-lline, invited for interview within one week of applying; conducted phone interview with two people; then in-person about two weeks later with the same people then a final phone call with the director. Smooth, clear process.
Interview Questions: Standard interview questions, experience, how you handle specific scenarios - no surprsises

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Dartmouth
Interview Descriptions: I had been asked about details about my research experience such as how I did a specific experiment
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Computer Store Salesman Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Dartmouth in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: Hiring process was fairly simple, heard about company through a colleague who had worked there. I was able to work there several summers during college, and really enjoyed the experience. I was lucky enough to quite well in this position, and the commission generated from it was fair enough to make it worth my while.
Interview Questions: What is the hardest decision you have had to make in your life?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Dartmouth
Interview Descriptions:
Short Interview with the concerned professor.
Asked about knowledge and experience with the subject matter.
Interview Questions: Did not remember a few specific things about certain parts of the subject so could not really answer them

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Dartmouth
Interview Descriptions: Very complicated, intensive process overall. First a phone interview with HR Manager, then in-person interview with HR Manager, which included correcting a writing sample for them to "grade" later. I then had to have another interview with HR where I had thirty minutes to write a letter describing what I felt the position to entail, after a conversation with the HR Manager when I could ask questions, etc. Finally, there was marathon afternoon of interviews, after which I barely knew my name. I met with 7 different people over three hours. Some where group interviews and some where one-on-one. Some where intense firing squad questions, some were more laidback, casual conversations. I was pleased the organization takes so much time and effort to hire the right people, but it was not the right fit for me.
Interview Questions: What would be most difficult about this position for you?

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at Dartmouth (Lebanon, NH) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: Day one involved many interviews (about 8) with different PIs lasting around a half-hour each. PIs will ask about Following this, there is a get together for dinner. Day two involved touring different labs and learning more about the program requirements.
Interview Questions: Q: What is your research experience? Have you been in charge of an independent research project?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Dartmouth in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: apply online and get offer later. Not a very difficult process but you need to do some research on the faculty and their research interests for a better chance to get the opportunity.
Interview Questions: which area are you interested in for graduate research

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Dartmouth (Hanover, NH) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: The first round is a committee to filter resumes by gpa, language test score, publications ,experiences. Then professor or PhD students will contact the applicants. Usually it happens in the beginning of a new year, and Dartmouth will send offers in Feb or March.
Interview Questions: Why do you apply Dartmouth? What's your research experience?

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Dartmouth (Hanover, NH) in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions:
Referred by a friend and interview process was pretty basic...average questions about experience and skills.  I met with my soon-to-be supervisor and it was very relaxed.  I didn't have to meet with anyone else and I received a call a week later to let me know I received the job and the salary, etc.
It really depends on what department and for what position you are applying for.
Interview Questions: What was your biggest failure and how did you deal with it?

title: Drill Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Dartmouth (Hanover, NH) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: There were three days of training, during which you learned the basics on the Rassias method. Then, on the third day, you had to pretend that your fellow competitors were your Spanish class, and you had to teach them according to this method. After about a ten-minute "pretend" Spanish class, you sat down and acted like a student for your fellow competitors. The whole process took no longer than one hour, and the professors typically took the full weekend to decide who they wanted to teach for them.
Interview Questions: Como aprendiste espanol, y porque quieres ensenar?

title: PhD Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Dartmouth (Hanover, NH) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: The interview process for Dartmouth is quite low key. Current students take prospective students through the labs & around the local area. Prospective students meet with up to 6 principal investigators to discuss research interests and better give them the opportunity to choose rotation labs.
Interview Questions:
Why would you like to pursue a graduate degree? 
What are your areas of interest for research?

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Dartmouth (Lebanon, NH) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: I directly contacted a principal investigator to express interest, sending in a cover letter and CV. I was invited to come visit, at which time I gave a short "job talk", met with faculty and staff, and discussed potential projects with the PI. An informal offer was made on site, and a formal written offer followed.
Interview Questions: What do you want to learn/investigate?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Dartmouth (Hanover, NH) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: They invite you to school for on-campus visit every year in Feb-March. It takes 2 full days. You will meet a lot of professors and talk with them about your research. Very productive and nice interview process.
Interview Questions: What's your previous experience in research?

title: LMS Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Dartmouth (Hanover, NH) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: I originally applied online on October 5th. I received an email to schedule a phone interview in mid November. The phone interview was with a committee of 8 people. Four weeks after the phone interview I was emailed to schedule an in person interview/campus visit which took place in early January. The in person interviews began at 8:30am and went through dinner. They consisted of several panel interviews, a 1 on 1 with the hiring manager, and a 30 minute presentation followed by a 30 minute Q&A. Lunch and dinner were also with the search committee and the prospective department members. The week after my interviews they began a very comprehensive reference check, and required to speak with current and previous supervisor. I declined the current and was informed that my offer would be contingent on that conversation. The final step was a conversation with HR where they asked my current and desired salary, and confirmed details for my background check. I got an offer 16 days after my campus visit.
Interview Questions: How do you keep up on current trends in your field (in the industry)?

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Dartmouth (Hanover, NH) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: I was overseas so the interview was done over Skype. Chatted with a bio professor and his grad student together. Didn't ask hard questions, mostly about the research i did as an undergrad. They also asked if i knew a specific type of PCR, I said I didn't... Than after about twenty minutes we started talking about the weather and day to day stuff... it was overall pretty pleasant and easy.
Interview Questions: describe your research project

title: Associate Director, Systems & Operations Interview
Application Type: The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Dartmouth (Hanover, NH) in Oct 2011
Interview Descriptions: I am a tough customer; I have read extensively and attempted to practice proper recruiting - I have to say that the recruiting process at Dartmouth is precisely how it is supposed to be to attract good talent - you deal directly with the hiring manager right from the start, and this remains your main point of contact throughout the process (no HR phone screens and other silly non-job related time sinks in this process). The in-person was a full day of panel interviews with all interested parties, from the CIO right on down to the department individual contribs. Again, the entire process was shepherded by the hiring manager. After meeting almost everyone, I was invited to meet one exec that was not there the day I was scheduled at a later date. The exec even met me half way for a breakfast meeting - a very fair and proper gesture. The meeting went well and an offer was conveyed to me shortly afterwards.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with SLA enforcement?

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Dartmouth (Hanover, NH) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions:
Get an A in the class that you want to tutor. After that, discuss the following questions: 
- Why do you want to be a tutor? 
- What class do you want to tutor? 
- Is there anyone in particular who you are trying to tutor?
Interview Questions:
Why do you want to be a tutor? 
What class do you want to tutor? 
Is there anyone in particular who you are trying to tutor?

title: Administrative Assistant III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Dartmouth (Hanover, NH) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: Full day itinerary for a basic clerical/administrative role: met with 3-4 interview panels throughout the day (with 3-4 interviewers per panel) for 30-60 minute sessions; met individually with HR director, hiring manager and director.  15 minute breaks included in schedule.
Interview Questions: Ex 1: Provide examples from your previous work experience that illustrate: your conflict resolution skills with coworkers or clients, quality of your attention to and detail, transferable skill sets.  Ex 2: Where do you see yourself in five years?

title: Assistant Teacher Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Dartmouth in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: Very friendly and approachable director. Interview process wasn't too hard and the center was very inviting. Employees where easy to work with and training was provided for employees to up to date on child development.
Interview Questions: Why would you be a good fit for the center?

title: Research Associate & Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Dartmouth (Hanover, NH) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: Was invited to the place of possible future job. Was asked about the experience with the devices present. Later it was a Power point presentation of the previous job achievements. After this the questions were asked about the my possible solutions to overcome the problems which the laboratory encountered (mainly sensitivity of the device).
Interview Questions: What was the main scientific achievement on my previous job?

title: Senior Programmer/Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Dartmouth (Hanover, NH) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: I met with a lot of people that ended up being my colleagues, and many of the faculty that I would be conducting work for.  The interview was very cordial and they probed about my technical background  and knowledge, but they also seemed very interested in my reasons for coming and hoping that I would enjoy living in the area and being a good fit for the group.  They were clearly looking for a long term hire, not someone that was going to leave in a year or so.
Interview Questions: With your background, you could work at a lot of different places.  What, specifically, interests you in working here?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Dartmouth (Hanover, NH) in Jan 2010
Interview Descriptions: Easy interview, I came here and presented in front of lab group. They were cordial and nice throughout the process. I got a tour of the place and loved the greenery. The place is safe and great to raise a family. Very peaceful. Thus, I decided to come here. Only, then I realized this is an empty place for career growth.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Dartmouth (Hanover, NH) in Jan 2009
Interview Descriptions: I had an unconventional interview process in that I had not originally applied for graduate school at Dartmouth, but happened to find myself talking to some of the professors.  The encouraged me to apply, I was accepted, and that was that.  Dartmouth is excellent in that it is a small enough school that individual professors and students can have a big impact on the department, and the upper management has a lot of faith in the professors.  Typically, however, the application process consists of making contact with a professor and asking if the are accepting graduate students.  This is a critical first step to applying to graduate school.  Next, you fill out the online paperwork and send transcripts, etc.  If they like you, they will offer you an interview.  For the interview, you are flown to Hanover, where there is a recruitment weekend.  The recruitment consists of giving a presentation in front of the department, seeing presentations by other applicants and professors (asking questions during these talks is an easy way to make yourself stand out).  You will also meet with individual professors at some point. Basically it is a weekend to feel scrutinized, in competition with your peers, and stressed out in general.  After that you go home, wait a few weeks and hope to hear from them.
Interview Questions: how would you define yourself as a scientist?

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Dartmouth (Hanover, NH) in Mar 2007
Interview Descriptions: HR contacted me about their interview offer. Setting up a time was easy, but for some reason, the interviewer had a hard time finding a place to interview me because the center was located in a remote place while their real buidling was newly being constructed. I found the interview to be simple and straightforward.
Interview Questions: How soon can you start?

title: Postdoctoral Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Dartmouth in Jan 2007
Interview Descriptions: Wrote to my prospective supervisor asking if there was an opening for a postdoc.  Interview consisted of dinner with a prospective colleague the night before, a one hour seminar on the day of the interview followed by 30 to 60 minute one on one interviews with each of the current lab members.  Job was offered on the same day as interview and accepted after two weeks.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.
